description:
Hanuman stands as one of the most revered and multifaceted figures in Hindu mythology. Revered as the deity of Anjaneya (Son of Anjana), Maruti (Son of Maruta/Vayu), Bajrangbali (One with Limbs Strong as Vajra/Thunderbolt), Hanuman embodies the fundamental forces that shape both the divine and mortal realms. 

According to Hindu sacred texts, Hanuman's origins represent eternal aspects of Brahman, cycling through cosmic ages and divine incarnations The worship of Hanuman became central to Hindu religious practice, with devotees seeking their favor through puja ceremonies, bhakti devotion, and sacred pilgrimages. 

Sacred symbols associated with Hanuman include Mace (gada), Mountain (carried to Lanka), Rama's image on his chest (eternal devotion). These emblems appear throughout Hindu art and literature, serving as powerful reminders of Hanuman's divine presence and authority. The mythology surrounding Hanuman reveals deep insights into Hindu worldview, particularly concerning Anjaneya (Son of Anjana) and humanity's relationship with the divine. 

The legacy of Hanuman extends far beyond ancient Hindu civilization. Hanuman continues to receive active worship by millions of devotees. The deity's philosophy and practices have influenced yoga, meditation, and spiritual movements globally Scholars continue to study Hanuman's mythology for its profound insights into Hindu culture, religion, and philosophy.

festivals.name: Hanuman Jayanti
festivals.description: Birthday celebration on the full moon of Chaitra month (March-April). Devotees fast, recite Hanuman Chalisa, and visit temples.

festivals.name: Ram Navami
festivals.description: Also celebrated as Hanuman's birth according to some traditions.

festivals.name: Every Tuesday
festivals.description: Special Hanuman worship day throughout the year.

topic_panels.title: Origins & Mythology
topic_panels.content:
### Sacred Origins

Hanuman's mythology cosmic ocean, Brahman manifestation, trimurti. The deity's role in Hindu cosmology reflects fundamental aspects of how ancient peoples understood divine power and cosmic order.

### Creation Accounts

Primary sources describe Hanuman's emergence and divine nature through various sacred narratives. These origin stories served both religious and cultural functions, establishing divine authority and cosmic principles.

**Time Period:** c. 1500 BCE - present

topic_panels.title: Worship & Practice
topic_panels.content:
### Religious Practice

Worship of Hanuman involved puja, bhakti, pilgrimage, festivals. These practices created sacred bonds between devotees and the divine realm.

### Sacred Sites

Throughout Indian subcontinent, temples and shrines dedicated to Hanuman served as focal points for religious activity. Priests and priestesses maintained sacred rituals that ensured divine favor and cosmic balance.

### Festivals & Ceremonies

Special festivals celebrated Hanuman's divine attributes and mythological deeds, bringing communities together in shared religious expression.

topic_panels.title: Symbols & Iconography
topic_panels.content:
### Sacred Symbols

Key symbols associated with Hanuman:

- **Mace (gada)**: Represents divine power and sacred authority
- **Mountain (carried to Lanka)**: Represents divine power and sacred authority
- **Rama's image on his chest (eternal devotion)**: Represents divine power and sacred authority
- **Orange/red color**: Represents divine power and sacred authority
- **Flying/leaping pose**: Represents divine power and sacred authority

### Divine Attributes

As deity of Anjaneya (Son of Anjana), Maruti (Son of Maruta/Vayu), Bajrangbali (One with Limbs Strong as Vajra/Thunderbolt), Kesari Nandan (Son of Kesari), Sankat Mochan (Remover of Difficulties), Mahavira (Great Hero), Pawanputra (Son of Wind), Devotion (Bhakti), Strength, Courage, Loyalty, Service, Celibacy (Brahmacharya), Protection, Wisdom, Humility, Removal of Obstacles, Hanuman embodies these cosmic principles. The iconography reveals how ancient peoples visualized divine power and cosmic forces.

### Artistic Representations

Ancient artworks depict Hanuman with distinctive attributes that communicate divine identity and authority to worshippers.

topic_panels.title: Modern Influence
topic_panels.content:
### Cultural Legacy

Yoga, meditation, New Age spirituality. The mythology of Hanuman continues to resonate in contemporary culture, literature, and spiritual practices.

### Academic Study

Modern scholars analyze Hanuman's mythology through multiple lenses‚Äîreligious studies, anthropology, archaeology, and comparative mythology‚Äîrevealing insights into ancient worldviews.

### Popular Culture

Hanuman appears in modern media, from fantasy novels to video games, demonstrating the enduring power of ancient mythology to capture human imagination and address timeless questions.

related_myths.title: The Birth of Hanuman
related_myths.summary: The sacred account of how Hanuman came into being, establishing their divine authority and cosmic role in Hindu mythology.

related_myths.title: Hanuman and the Sacred Quest
related_myths.summary: A legendary tale of Hanuman's heroic deeds or cosmic achievements that shaped the world and demonstrated divine power.

related_myths.title: Hanuman and the Divine Council
related_myths.summary: Stories of Hanuman's interactions with other deities, revealing the complex relationships and hierarchies of the Hindu pantheon.

related_myths.title: Hanuman and the Gift of Anjaneya (Son of Anjana)
related_myths.summary: The mythological account of how Hanuman became associated with Anjaneya (Son of Anjana) and bestowed this gift upon humanity or the cosmos.

related_myths.title: The Legacy of Hanuman
related_myths.summary: How Hanuman's actions and teachings continue to influence the world, establishing sacred traditions and cosmic principles.
